questions.description: The magnetic field due to a long current carrying wire is directed :
A proton moves along horizontal line and towards observer, the pattern of concentric circular field lines of magnetic field which produced due to its motion :
The direction of magnetic field produced at the centre of a current carrying coil is :

options.description: perpendicular to the plane of the coil
parallel to diameter and tangent to the edge of the coil

questions.description: The following statements is false for Helmholtz coils :

options.description: In Helmholtz coils, both coils are coaxial
Planes of Helmholtz coils are perpendicular to each other
The distance between coils is equal to the radius of either coil
The magnetic field produced at the central part between the coils is uniform

questions.description: The direction of magnetic lines of force produced by passing a direct current in a conductor :

options.description: perpendicular to the conductor and going outward
perpendicular to the conductor and coming inward
surrounding the conductor and of circular nature

questions.description: The value of magnetic induction inside a long solenoid along the axis :

options.description: decreases with distance from the axis
increases with distance from the axis

questions.description: Number of turns of solenoid is doubled and current is one fourth then produced magnetic field becomes :

Assertion : The magnetic field at the ends of a very long current carrying solenoid is half of that of the centre.
Reason : If the solenoid is sufficiently long the field within it is uniform.

options.description: Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is correct explanation of Assertion.
Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not correct explanation of Assertion.
Assertion is true and Reason is wrong.
Both Assertion and Reason are wrong.

questions.description: In a current carrying long solenoid the field produced does not depend on :

options.description: number of turns per unit length
radius of cross section of the solenoid

questions.description:
Assertion : When radius of current carrying circular loop is doubled its magnetic moment becomes four times.
Reason : Magnetic moment of current carrying circular loop is M = IA.

options.description: Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is correct explanation of Assertion.
Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not correct explanation of Assertion.
Assertion is true and Reason is wrong.
Both Assertion and Reason are wrong.

questions.description: When a magnetic needle is placed in a non-uniform magnetic field then :

options.description: force act on it and torque may act on it
only force acts on it and not the torque
only torque acts on it and not force
neither force nor torque acts on it

questions.description:
Assertion : A current carrying closed loop remains in equilibrium in a uniform and constant magnetic field parallel to its axis. Consider forces only due to this magnetic field.
Reason : Torque on a current carrying closed loop due to a magnetic field is maximum when the plane of the coil is parallel to the direction of the magnetic field.

options.description: Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is correct explanation of Assertion.
Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not correct explanation of Assertion.
Assertion is true and Reason is wrong.
Both Assertion and Reason are wrong.

questions.description: A current carrying circular coil is vertically suspended. The coil come to rest in :
If a charged particle enters in a uniform magnetic field, neither perpendicular, nor parallel, then its path will be:
An electron is moving along positive x-axis. To get it moving on an anti-clockwise circular path in x-y plane, a magnetic field is applied :

Assertion : If a charged particle is released from rest in a region of uniform electric and magnetic fields parallel to each other, it will move in a straight line.
Reason : The electric field exerts no force on the particle but the magnetic field does.

options.description: Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is correct explanation of Assertion.
Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not correct explanation of Assertion.
Assertion is true and Reason is wrong.
Both Assertion and Reason are wrong.

questions.description: If the current in a circular coil is doubled and this coil is rebounded such that number of turns is reduced to half then value of magnetic field at center of coil will be:
A charged particle is moving in the direction of a magnetic field. The magnetic force acting on the particle :

options.description: is in the direction of its velocity
is in the direction opposite to its velocity

questions.description: The radius of a circular path of a charged particle moving in a magnetic field is proportional to the :
Ratio of dimensions of electric field to the magnetic field is equal to the dimensions of which physical quantity :

Assertion : When neutron is projected perpendicular to an electric field. Then its trajectory is parabolic.
Reason : A moving charge entering parallel to the magnetic field lines moves in a circular path.

options.description: Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is correct explanation of Assertion.
Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not correct explanation of Assertion.
Assertion is true and Reason is wrong.
Both Assertion and Reason are wrong.

questions.description: If a charged particle at rest experience no electromagnetic force, then :

options.description: the electric field must be zero
the magnetic field must be zero
the electric and magnetic fields are equal
the electric field may or may not be zero

questions.description: Mutual interaction between which of the following pairs does not takes place :

options.description: Charge beam and current carrying wire

questions.description: The time period of a charged particle undergoing a circular motion in a uniform magnetic field is independent of its :
If an electron and a proton having same momentum enters perpendicular to a magnetic field, then :

options.description: curved path of electron and proton will be same (ignoring the sense of revolution)
curved path of electron is more curved than that of the proton
path of proton is more curved

questions.description: A charge is released from rest in a region of steady and uniform electric and magnetic fields which are parallel to each other. The charge will moves along which path :-
A stationary magnet does not interact with :-
An electron is travelling along the x-direction. It encounters a magnetic field in the y-direction. Its subsequent motion will be :

options.description: a circle in the x-z plane
a circle in the y-z plane
a circle in the x-y plane

questions.description: There is a magnetic field acting in a plane perpendicular to this sheet of paper, downward into the paper as shown in figure. Particles in vacuum move in the plane of paper from left of right. The path indicated by the arrow could be travelled by :
A charge q is in a circular motion, perpendicular to the magnetic field B. The angular velocity of charge in radian per second will be :
The charges 1, 2, 3 are moving in uniform transverse magnetic field then :

options.description: particle 1 and 3 are positive and particle 2 neutral

questions.description: A proton, a deuteron and α-particle are accelerated by the same potential difference enter in uniform perpendicular magnetic field B. The ratio of kinetic energies will be :
If a current is passed through a spring then the spring will :
P, Q and R long parallel straight line wires in air, carrying currents as shown. The direction of resultant force on R is :

options.description: the same as that of current in Q

questions.description: A wire 'LN' bent as shown in figure is placed in uniform perpendicular magnetic field of 5T. A 10A current flows through the wire. Magnetic force experience by the wire is :

A current 'I' is flowing through wire PQR. This wire is bent in form of an angle and placed is uniform magnetic field 'B' according to figure. If PQ = l and  PQR= 60°. The ratio of magnetic forces on PQ to QR respectively :
